thread.title: Gareth Morgan's party to take on Jacinda Ardern in Mt Albert by-election
thread.title_full: Gareth Morgan's party to take on Jacinda Ardern in Mt Albert by-election

author: Sam Sachdeva
title: Gareth Morgan's party to take on Jacinda Ardern in Mt Albert by-election
text:
Gareth Morgan's party to take on Jacinda Ardern in Mt Albert by-election SAM SACHDEVA Last updated 11:06, February 1 2017 Cameron Burnell/Fairfax NZ 
Gareth Morgan's party will run in Mt Albert against Jacinda Ardern. 
Millionaire economist Gareth Morgan has confirmed his party will take on Labour MP Jacinda Ardern in this month's Mt Albert by-election. 
However, Morgan himself will not run. Instead, his Opportunity Party chief of staff Geoff Simmons has put his name forward to run in the February 25 by-election. 
Speaking in Mt Albert, Morgan said the decision of National and other parties not to contest the by-election meant "there's an opportunity here to do something for the people of Mt Albert". Jacinda welcomes Gareth Morgan to Mt AlbertðŸ˜‰ @jacindaardern pic.twitter.com/8B4cWTFQam â€” Grant Robertson (@grantrobertson1) January 31, 2017 
Simmons had been responsible for a lot of the policy work at Morgan's foundation, and was "extremely literate in all that material". 
READ MORE: 
Labour and the Greens had "constructed some sort of pretence" that they would compete with each other in the electorate, when they were "supposed to be sisters in arms". Derek Flynn 
Labour Party MP Jacinda Ardern is the heavy favourite for the February 25 by-election in Mt Albert. 
Morgan acknowledged the party's campaign would be "a bit of a David and Goliath", with both Labour and the Greens having an established party machinery. 
When he launched Top last November, Morgan said the party would be list-only, with no electorate candidates. "I'm only happy with five per cent...I want to be there in sufficient numbers to have influence." 
Ardern, the frontrunner for the by-election, has already welcomed Morgan's potential challenge, with colleague Grant Robertson alluding to the millionaire's campaign against cats in a message on Twitter. 
In January Morgan revealed he was reconsidering his party list-only approach after "being approached by some pretty outstanding candidates who wish to stand in electorates". 
"While personally I don't want to go near Parliament without a significant mandate for progress, there are both younger and regionally-oriented people already amongst our membership who would form a great ongoing parliamentary team." 
Each proposal to run in an electorate would be assessed on its merits, Morgan said. 
The Mt Albert by-election was triggered by the resignation of Labour MP David Shearer, who has taken up a job at the United Nations in South Sudan. 
Green MP Julie Anne Genter has also put her name forward to replace Shearer in the seat. 
The close of nominations for by-election comes as Prime Minister Bill English prepares to announce the date for the 2017 election on Wednesday afternoon. - Stuff
